text: disrupting again the Amazon founder had
promised us something a little different
and within minutes he delivered I hope
that you guys have as much fun using
this phone as we had building it and
here it is the new Amazon fire phone now
it looks like a standard smart phone
it's got a decent back camera 13
megapixel but what's more interesting
about it is the four front cameras right
here they're infrared cameras and that
means the phone can track my facial
movements and my eyes as a result the
handset adjusts my view of the screen to
give an impressive 3d effect which
Amazon is calling dynamic perspective
app developers can use it in a number of
ways for example when browsing on a map
to reveal more information or more
tellingly when shopping in Amazon's
store the other standout feature Firefly
a way for the phone to visually
recognize up to 100 million real-world
objects or should that be products as it
will provide yet another seamless way
for users to order goods from the
e-tailer itself Amazon's device will
stand out it is very different the key
question is will that be seen as
innovative or a gimmick it's not just
the hardware there were other
differentiators too like the Mayday Live
help feature but the overall aim is to
ensure Amazon's growing empire is front
and center about everyday interactions
Jeff Bezos is clearly bringing a unique
perspective to the smartphone market but
this is an arena where many more
established tech players have fallen and
only to Apple and Samsung make any real
money the Amazon boss spoke of the
challenges developing the fire phone
over several years you can't help
feeling his greatest challenge yet
still lies ahead richard taylor BBC news
seattle
